column4: im looking for a http redirecting service to bypass router restrictions
you could use tor
tnx for hint, would vpn for ubuntu do that too?
it could, but vpn wouldn't be the easier of the two.
all you need is a proxy. If you need the resources on another network, or you want your browsing to be done through a consistent and known network, then vpn would be better
otherwise, just use Tor with a browser button or vidalia
tnx
if it's just for one website you could also use a web-based proxy like proxify.com or ninjaproxy.com
the proxy websites are also blocked by the linux router restrictions (hotspot provider)
if you're at a hotspot, you can probably set manual dns servers for that hotspot. edit the connection, change auto dns to google's public dns servers 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4
you might have to reconnect to the hotspot (not sure)
i hear good things about mullvad too for ubuntu (swedish vpn)
maybe, but if you just need to get to sites blocked at a public hotspot, setting your own dns will probably do the trick. It depends on the talent of the person setting it up  ;)
its pretty talented because its a linux restricted hotspot with lotta proxy's added to restrictions
any url you know of that could bypass such?

but they might only be blocking the dns requests. The Starbucks and Coffee Culture I go to both filter sites with DNS. By not using their dns, nothing is blocked, and then I use a proxy or Tor for privacy
nice, tnx for the trick mate
np.
with the route add
but it will take a good look at the man page

I thought that if the subnet for his server is 3 255.255.255.0 then all non "this subnet" packets will go to the default gateway (internet). Not all routers will let you hit the outside ip from within the network
he got windows laptop yes, but he wants to try the ubuntu laptop with openssh server running
it's on the same subnet.
